notes.text:
An update for thunderbird is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Mozilla Thunderbird is a standalone mail and newsgroup client.

This update upgrades Thunderbird to version 91.7.0.

Security Fix(es):

* Mozilla: Use-after-free in XSLT parameter processing (CVE-2022-26485)

* Mozilla: Use-after-free in WebGPU IPC Framework (CVE-2022-26486)

* expat: Malformed 2- and 3-byte UTF-8 sequences can lead to arbitrary code execution (CVE-2022-25235)

* expat: Namespace-separator characters in "xmlns[:prefix]" attribute values can lead to arbitrary code execution (CVE-2022-25236)

* expat: Integer overflow in storeRawNames() (CVE-2022-25315)

* Mozilla: Use-after-free in text reflows (CVE-2022-26381)

* Mozilla: Browser window spoof using fullscreen mode (CVE-2022-26383)

* Mozilla: iframe allow-scripts sandbox bypass (CVE-2022-26384)

* Mozilla: Time-of-check time-of-use bug when verifying add-on signatures (CVE-2022-26387)

* thunderbird: Crafted email could trigger an out-of-bounds write (CVE-2022-0566)

* Mozilla: Temporary files downloaded to /tmp and accessible by other local users (CVE-2022-26386)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A flaw was found in Thunderbird. The vulnerability occurs due to an out-of-bounds write of one byte when processing the message. This flaw allows an attacker to craft an email message that causes Thunderbird to perform an out-of-bounds write.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: thunderbird: Crafted email could trigger an out-of-bounds write
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running instances of Thunderbird must be restarted for the update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: thunderbird: Crafted email could trigger an out-of-bounds write

notes.text: A flaw was found in expat. Passing malformed 2- and 3-byte UTF-8 sequences (for example, from start tag names) to the XML processing application on top of expat can lead to arbitrary code execution. This issue is dependent on how invalid UTF-8 is handled inside the XML processor.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: expat: Malformed 2- and 3-byte UTF-8 sequences can lead to arbitrary code execution
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This flaw affects applications that leverage expat to parse untrusted XML files. Applications that only parse trusted XML files or do not process XML files at all are not affected by this flaw.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running instances of Thunderbird must be restarted for the update to take effect.
There is no known mitigation other than restricting applications using the expat library from processing untrusted XML content. Please update the affected packages as soon as possible.

vulnerabilities.title: expat: Malformed 2- and 3-byte UTF-8 sequences can lead to arbitrary code execution

notes.text: A flaw was found in expat. Passing one or more namespace separator characters in the "xmlns[:prefix]" attribute values made expat send malformed tag names to the XML processor on top of expat. This issue causes arbitrary code execution depending on how unexpected cases are handled inside the XML processor.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: expat: Namespace-separator characters in "xmlns[:prefix]" attribute values can lead to arbitrary code execution
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This flaw affects applications that leverage expat to parse untrusted XML files. Applications that only parse trusted XML files or do not process XML files at all are not affected by this flaw.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running instances of Thunderbird must be restarted for the update to take effect.
There is no known mitigation other than restricting applications using the expat library from processing untrusted XML content. Please update the affected packages as soon as possible.

vulnerabilities.title: expat: Namespace-separator characters in "xmlns[:prefix]" attribute values can lead to arbitrary code execution

notes.text: An integer overflow was found in expat. The issue occurs in storeRawNames() by abusing the m_buffer expansion logic to allow allocations very close to INT_MAX and out-of-bounds heap writes. This flaw can cause a denial of service or potentially arbitrary code execution.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: expat: Integer overflow in storeRawNames()
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This flaw affects applications that leverage expat to parse untrusted XML files. Applications that only parse trusted XML files or do not process XML files at all are not affected by this flaw.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running instances of Thunderbird must be restarted for the update to take effect.
There is no known mitigation other than restricting applications using the expat library from processing untrusted XML content. Please update the affected packages as soon as possible.

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

An attacker could have caused a use-after-free issue by forcing a text reflow in an SVG object, leading to a potentially exploitable crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Use-after-free in text reflows
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Product Security rates the severity of this flaw as determined by the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running instances of Thunderbird must be restarted for the update to take effect.

cwe.name: The UI Performs the Wrong Action

notes.text: A flaw was found in Mozilla. The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as: When resizing a popup after requesting fullscreen access, the popup would not display the fullscreen notification.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Browser window spoof using fullscreen mode
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running instances of Thunderbird must be restarted for the update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Browser window spoof using fullscreen mode

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

If an attacker could control the contents of an iframe sandboxed with allow-popups but not allow-scripts, they were able to craft a link that, when clicked, would lead to JavaScript execution in violation of the sandbox.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: iframe allow-scripts sandbox bypass
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Product Security rates the severity of this flaw as determined by the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running instances of Thunderbird must be restarted for the update to take effect.

notes.text: The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as: Previously Thunderbird for macOS and Linux would download temporary files to a user-specific directory in /tmp, but this behavior was changed to download them to /tmp where they could be affected by other local users. This behavior was reverted to the original, user-specific directory.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Temporary files downloaded to /tmp and accessible by other local users
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running instances of Thunderbird must be restarted for the update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Temporary files downloaded to /tmp and accessible by other local users

notes.text: A flaw was found in Mozilla. The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as follows: When installing an add-on, Firefox verified the signature before prompting the user; but while the user was confirming the prompt, the underlying add-on file could have been modified, and Firefox would not have noticed.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Time-of-check time-of-use bug when verifying add-on signatures
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running instances of Thunderbird must be restarted for the update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Time-of-check time-of-use bug when verifying add-on signatures

names: Wang Gang, Liu Jialei, Du Sihang, Huang Yi & Yang Kang of 360 ATA

notes.text: A flaw was found in Mozilla. The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as: Removing an XSLT parameter during processing could have led to an exploitable use-after-free issue. There were reports of attacks in the wild abusing this flaw.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Use-after-free in XSLT parameter processing
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

All running instances of Thunderbird must be restarted for the update to take effect.

notes.text: An unexpected message in the WebGPU IPC framework could lead to an exploitable sandbox escape and a use-after-free issue. An attacker with enough privileges could exploit this flaw leading to a complete system compromise
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Use-after-free in WebGPU IPC Framework
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
